headline: Poll Shows Brazil President Could Face Runoff
summary: The latest poll of Brazilian voters is showing for the first time that President Dilma Rousseff may face a runoff in October's presidential election.

headline: Photos: Berkshire Hathaway's Annual Meeting
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway hosts its annual meeting this weekend in Omaha, Neb.

headline: Northern Irish Police Extend Adams Jail Stay
summary: Anger grew on the republican side of the political divide in Northern Ireland on Saturday as Sinn FÃ©in President Gerry Adams spent a third day under arrest in connection with an unsolved IRA killing.

headline: Pro-Russia Militants Release OSCE Observers
summary: Military observers for the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe who have been held by pro-Russian militants for more than a week have been released.

headline: German Foreign Minister Warns Violence in Ukraine Can Become Unstoppable
summary: German Foreign Minister Frank-Walter Steinmeier warned of a further escalation of violence in Ukraine after riots in Odessa and other cities claimed dozens of lives.

headline: Slovenian Prime Minister to Step Down
summary: Slovenian Prime Minister Alenka Bratusek said she will step down next week to allow for parliamentary elections to take place in June, a week after she lost the leadership of her party.

headline: High-Tech Homes the Jetsons Would Fancy
summary: Stylish on the outside, state of the art on the inside. Developers are adding pricey new futuristic features; in these homes, the refrigerator talks to the oven, and a fingerprint lets the dog walker in

headline: Russia Calls Ukraine Elections 'Absurd'
summary: A Kremlin spokesman called the coming presidential elections in Ukraine "absurd," citing an unwinding "spiral of confrontation" in southeastern Ukraine as the main obstacle, the Interfax news agency reported.

headline: What's News: World-Wide
summary: What's News: World-Wide Top Stories for May 3-4, 2014

headline: Buffett Defends Coca-Cola Abstention
summary: Berkshire Hathaway held its annual meeting in Omaha, Neb. on Saturday, with Chairman Warren Buffett once again defending his decision to abstain from voting on a Coca-Cola Co. equity compensation plan.
